humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, sentinel lymph nodes #1 and #2 are both positive for metastatic carcinoma. Based on the new rules provided, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has cancer that has metastasized to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes, with the largest tumor deposit being 0.5 cm or less in size. This corresponds to a pathologic N1 stage (pN1). This information can be found in section B of the report, which states 'one (1) lymph node positive for metastatic carcinoma on H and E and immunohistologic sections' and 'tumor seen is approximately 0.5 cm in size'.
